alert.note: Alert for Gage (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 14 at 8:35PM CDT until April 15 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT FOR JOHNSON...SOUTHWESTERN OTOE AND NORTHEASTERN GAGE COUNTIES... At 833 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Douglas to 2 miles southeast of Sterling to 4 miles northeast of Lewiston, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. These storms have a history of producing wind damage to road signs and power poles. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Douglas around 840 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Palmyra and Cook. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
